item.title: Destiny 2 Excision Bug Sees One Guardian Destroying The Witness Singlehandedly
item.description:
This article has MAJOR SPOILERS for Destiny 2: The Final Shape

The new Excision activity introduced with Destiny 2 's Final Shape expansion represents the game's first ever 12-player activity, but one fan finds themselves putting an end to The Witness all by themselves after a bug prevents their friends from using their super abilities. Fans have encountered a variety of odd bugs throughout many of Destiny 2 's new activities, both in content from The Final Shape as well as the first episode, Echoes.

Representing the incredible final mission of Destiny 2 's Final Shape campaign and the biggest battle of the game's entire decade-long history, Excision sees a total of 12 Guardians teaming up alongside the many allies of humanity to launch a final assault on The Witness after its hold on The Traveler is broken during the new Salvation's Edge raid. The Grandmaster difficulty version of this activity recently became available to players, offering capable players the chance to earn pinnacle rewards, ascendant shards, an Ergo Sum exotic sword, and the Ergo Sum catalyst.

At the end of Destiny 2 's Excision mission, all 12 Guardians receive the ability to use a special, one-off super that allows them to blast The Witness into space dust with the Traveler's Light, but one fireteam experiences a strange bug which allows only one player to use this ability. A clip shared online by the user Lightningboltzl demonstrates how their team could only watch as this player was the only one able to end The Witness with this super, and though it did take a lot longer than it usually would, the player was able to completely unmake The Witness and bring the mission to a close all by themselves.

One Destiny Player Defeats The Witness By Themselves

While they couldn't partake in the final stand themselves, the player's teammates were able to hype them up using the team text chat, labeling them as "the chosen one" due to the comical circumstances. Many other Destiny 2 fans online have echoed these sorts of sentiments, claiming that this player must be the canonical "main character" of the Destiny 2 universe, with others pointing out how this awesome moment in Destiny 2 looks like something out of Dragon Ball Z .

Fans have discovered quite a few glaring issues affecting Destiny 2 's Excision mission, with bugs resulting in players getting kicked to orbit and experiencing low frame rates, making the activity all the more problematic when played on the Grandmaster difficulty. This is likely due to the abnormally large fireteam size that can deploy to this activity, though the argument of whether future Destiny 2 activities should continue to accommodate 12 players even at the cost of performance and stability remains a prominent one among the Destiny 2 community.

item.title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A Has a Clear Successor to Arceus' Spiritomb Quest
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon Legends Z-A may borrow the Spiritomb quest concept to encourage exploration in Lumiose City.
  • Mega Evolution's return in Kalos region may play a significant role in the game's narrative and quests.
  • Pokemon Legends Z-A could imitate the famous Spiritomb quest from PL: Arceus with a Mega Stone collectathon.

Pokemon Legends Z-A has a lot to live up to in the shadow of Legends Arceus , especially when it comes to quests. Looking back at Legends Arceus ’ Spiritomb quest might inspire a similar one in Pokemon Legends Z-A .

In Pokemon Legends Arceus , one of the most memorable (and at times frustrating) quests was Eerie Apparitions at Night. Inspired by Spiritomb, the quest saw players scouring the Hisui Region to collect 107 wisps, which create Spiritomb once they are all placed inside the Odd Keystone. The wisps in Pokemon Legends Arceus could be difficult to find, but the search gave players an extra objective and a reason to search the map even more than the main story gave them. With quests like this one, Legends Z-A needs to bring spectacular side content as well, and the return of mega evolution might help. If Legends Z-A uses the Spiritomb quest as inspiration, it may have the basis of another expansive questline.

Side Quests in Pokemon Legends Z-A

Since Legends Z-A takes place just in Lumiose City, its map likely won’t be as large as Legends Arceus ’, but players will still need reasons to explore every inch of it. Side quests are an important part of games like the Pokemon Legends series because they expand the world and the story, and encourage players to seek out areas they might miss otherwise. With the reconstruction and expansion of the city at the core of Legends Z-A ’s story, those goals might be a good excuse to implement fetch quests. The completion of this game’s version of the Pokedex will also probably play an important role.

A Clear Successor to Eerie Apparitions at Night

The importance of good side quests means that Legends Z-A might want to borrow some successful strategies from Legends Arceus . Eerie Apparitions at Night is a very time-intensive inclusion, and is one of several scavenger hunt type quests in Pokemon Legends Arceus , so it would be a good basis for a similar quest in the game's successor. Sending the player out to locate mass quantities of a certain material or phenomenon enforces the exploration basis the Legends series has adopted and could lead to players discovering more of the new Lumiose City as they search. Pokemon Legends Z-A even has the perfect collectible staring it in the face.

With the return of the Kalos region comes the return of Mega Evolution, something fans have spent years asking for, and it will probably take on an important role in the narrative of the game. In the other Pokemon games, Mega Evolution can only be used when the player and their Pokemon are holding the appropriate Mega Stone. In Pokemon X and Y , some of these stones are gifted to the player during the story, but others are only obtainable in a post-game quest. As part of the quest, stones will appear at certain parts of the map at certain times of day, which mirrors the wisps in Legends Arceus being easier to find at night. Though it may be a coincidence, this gives Game Freak the perfect blueprint for a successor to the Spiritomb quest.

If players want to discover new and fan favorite Pokemon Mega Evolutions, they might have to earn them in this quest. By searching for each Mega Stone, or maybe shards of Mega Stones that must be pieced back together, exploration will feel more natural. The task might seem tedious at times, like the Spiritomb quest, but the rewards would be even greater, powering up players' favorite Pokemon for stronger battles. No one can be certain what lies ahead in Pokemon Legends Z-A , but it's a safe bet that this type of quest might be in store.

item.title: Destiny 2: Xur Exotic Armor, Weapon, and Recommendations for June 28
item.description:
Highlights

  • Destiny 2 exotic weekend merchant returns to the Tower Bazaar with a new selection of weapons, resources, and armor.
  • Players can purchase Hawkmoon, The Wardcliff Coil, Prometheus Lens, and Monte Carlo exotic weapons.
  • For exotic armor, Xur has Peregrine Greaves, St0mp-EE5, and the Skull of Dire Ahamkara.

Xur has returned again to Destiny 2 , complete with new exotic and legendary gear for players to check out for a limited time. With the weekend merchant arriving once more, exotics have recently been a hot topic with the community as Bungie announced plans to nerf three very popular options. Khvostov and Red Death are seeing tweaks to their stability and recoil patterns, with the former also seeing its Ricochet Shots being altered as well, though many of these alterations are only impacting the PvP side of Destiny 2 .

Speaker's Sight, a Warlock exotic helm intended to look like the former NPC of the Tower, has also been overperforming thanks to its ability to rapidly generate orbs. Given its status as a great support exotic, Bungie is suspending its ability to generate a orbs while in Crucible matches as Bungie felt the exotic was able to produce a substantial amount that would ultimately undermine the long-term health of PvP. While the PvE side of Destiny 2 is unaffected, Bungie will be revisiting the exotic down the road for a better long-term solution.

In the meantime, the weekend merchant Xur has brought a brand-new inventory of exotics and legendary gear for Destiny 2 players. Follow this guide for his current weekend location, news on his exotic cipher quest, as well as a review of all the exotic and legendary gear he's brought for the weekend of June 28, 2024.

Where is Xur?

For those who may have missed it, Xur has taken up residence in the Bazaar of The Tower, so there's no more hunting when the weekend comes around.

Since the Bazaar area is between both fast travel points, players can pick either one to load into. Head into the area where Ikora and Hawthorne are and look for the little Ramen Shop towards the back wall. While facing the shop, the alley is to the right, where Xur is standing.

Destiny 2 Class Armor and Exotic Cipher

Xur's role continues to offer the usual weekly quests, exotics, and legendary gear. Not only are these quests required to purchase a second fated engram, but they're necessary to acquire legacy exotic gear from the Tower kiosk. Players can earn a new cipher by completing strikes and winning crucible or gambit matches. Gain bonus points for playing with clan mates or finishing more challenging activities.

Xur's Exotic Armor

Skull of Dire Ahamkara - Warlock helmet

Exotic Perks :

  • Actual Grandeur - Provides additional damage resistance during Nova Bomb. Nova Bomb kills grant Super energy.

Another solid exotic, that, at one point, was the go-to armor for Voidwalkers due to how strong it was. While the Skull is nowhere near that level these days, it will help Warlocks get their supers back faster, though it likely isn't at the top of the meta anymore.

Stat Values (67 Total):

  • Mobility +10
  • Resilience +13
  • Recovery +12
  • Discipline +7
  • Intellect +19
  • Strength +6

St0mp-EE5 - Hunter leg armor

Exotic Perk :

  • Hydraulic Boosters - Increases sprint speed and slide distance, and improves High Jump, Strafe Jump, and Triple Jump. Take less damage from targets when airborne.

A fairly balanced roll this week, outside the spike of Intelligence, though using mods, can make these a solid pickup.

Stat Values (68 Total):

  • Mobility +14
  • Resilience +11
  • Recovery +10
  • Discipline +10
  • Intellect +17
  • Strength +6

Peregrine Greaves - Titan leg armor

Exotic Perk :

  • Peregrine Strike - All shoulder charge abilities (Seismic Strike, Hammer Strike, or Shield Bash) deal bonus damage when activated in the air. Damaging mini-bosses, Tormentors, or Champions with your shoulder charge refunds your melee. Provides a small benefit to the airborne effectiveness stat of all weapons.

It's a tough recommendation this week, as Xur has seemingly returned to his old tricks of giving Titan armor higher than necessary mobility stats.

Stat Values (64 total):

  • Mobility +16
  • Resilience +11
  • Recovery +6
  • Discipline +9
  • Intellect +2
  • Strength +20

Xur Inventory Items

Year 7 in Destiny 2 has upgraded Xur's inventory, adding a true rank progression system, rewards, as well as focusing options. Xur also has more than just weapons and armor as well, including:

  • Polaris Lance Catalyst
  • Jotunn Catalyst
  • Exotic Engram
  • Glimmer
  • Ascendant Alloy
  • Enhancement Cores
  • Vanguard Engram
  • Strange Gift (Random Item for 1 Strange Coin)

Xur's Exotic Weapons

Year 7's Xur revamp has also added the ability to offer multiple exotic weapons in one visit. Here is what Xur has this weekend:

Hawkmoon

  • Paracausal Shot - Final blows and precision hits with Hawkmoon grant stacks of Paracausal Charge. The final round in the magazine deals bonus damage based on the number of stacks. Stowing Hawkmoon on the final round removes this bonus.
  • Arrowhead Brake
  • Alloy Magazine
  • Eye of the Storm
  • Combat Grip

Monte Carlo

  • Monte Carlo Method - Dealing damage with this weapon reduces melee cooldown and grants a chance to fully charge melee ability with each kill.
  • Markov Chain - This weapon gains increased damage from melee kills and kills with this weapon. Melee kills grant ammo for this weapon.
  • Fluted Barrel
  • High Caliber Rounds
  • Composite Stock

Prometheus Lens

  • Prismatic Inferno - Fires a Solar trace beam that creates a field of heat energy that grows as the weapon is fired. Sustained damage applies scorch to the target.
  • Flame Refraction - Kills with this weapon return a fraction of the ammo used to the magazine from reserves, extending the beam's duration.
  • Chambered Compensator
  • Projection Fuse
  • Composite Stock

The Wardcliff Coil

  • Mad Scientist - This weapon fires a volley of rockets.
  • Mechanized Autoloader -This weapon automatically reloads on ammo pickup.
  • Volatile Launch
  • Extended Mag
  • Composite Stock

Xur's Destiny 2 Legendary Armor Set and Weapons

Xur's Set of Legendary Armor and Weapons. All gear costs 50 Legendary Shards and 1000 Glimmer.

  • Ignition Code (Kinetic Grenade Launcher)
  • Sole Survivor (Energy Sniper Rifle)
  • Death Adder (Energy Submachine Gun)
  • Seventh Seraph SI-2 (Energy Sidearm)
  • Seventh Seraph SAW (Heavy Machine Gun)
  • Memory Interdict (Heavy Grenade Launcher)
  • Crown-Splitter (Heavy Sword)
  • Strange Weapon Engram
  • Substitutional Alloy Armor Set

item.title: Shadow Of The Erdtree: Romina, Saint of the Bud Boss Guide - Elden Ring DLC
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Reach Romina, Saint of the Bud In Elden Ring Shadow Of The Erdtree
  • How To Beat Romina, Saint of the Bud In Elden Ring Shadow Of The Erdtree

Finding Romina, Saint of the Bud is harder than beating them in Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree . They’re unskippable since they guard the way to reach the final boss in Shadow of the Erdtree .

One of the best things about defeating bosses is getting their Remembrance, which is an item that grants you one of their weapons or spells they use against you. Not to mention, the number of runes you collect from defeating these endgame bosses. If players are struggling to beat this abomination, they can read on for some tips on how to beat Romina, Saint of the Bud in Elden Ring DLC .

How To Reach Romina, Saint of the Bud In Elden Ring Shadow Of The Erdtree

It doesn’t take long to reach Romina, Saint of the Bud if you know your way around the Ancient Ruins of Rauh in Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree . However, if it’s your first time exploring the jungle of the Land of Shadow, there are many creatures and mazes waiting to stop you from reaching the Church of the Bud.

Start from the Shadow Keep’s Store House, First Floor Site of Lost Grace, and take your left to find an elevator.

Once you get off the elevator, take your right and keep moving until the first door appears on your left. Be careful, a Living Jar is waiting to ambush you there. However, still, take that door, jump down the balcony, and keep moving forward.

Once you make it to the West Rampart Site of Lost Grace, you’ll find a tiny door next to the huge gate in front of you. Open that door to find a bridge filled with enemies behind it. Defeat them and proceed forward until you reach the second elevator that takes you out of the Shadow Keep into the Ancient Ruins of Rauh in Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree .

Once you’re out of the Shadow Keep, go west and keep following that road until you stumble upon ancient ruins with no name. Go inside and keep moving northwest to find the first gate to your right. Open it to find some scorpions and the second gate should be to the hard left.

After you’re out of the second gate, keep moving southwest to find the third gate behind a large pillar in the middle of the chamber. Go through and move forward to descend through the gap in front of you with the help of the Spiritspring. Once you make it down, keep taking your left, riding your Torrent under multiple bridges. Eventually, you’ll find the Rauh Ancient Ruins, East Site of Lost Grace.

From there, jump to the bridge next to you and move to the southwest, following the bridge’s road. Be careful as a Furnace Golem will wake up once you touch that bridge and start shooting fire at you. Reach the end of the bridge and jump to the right onto another bridge that leads to the Furnace Golem’s area. Once you’re there, keep heading south without taking any side to finally reach another Site of Lost Grace.

The final area before reaching Romina, Saint of the Bud, is a little tricky since it also has a few mazes and enemies protecting their corridors. First, take the southeastern stairs and turn right once you’re on top. Inside that chamber, take your left and follow that corridor to find an elevator at its end.

After making it out, keep heading north to find a small gate that leads into a chamber filled with Pests and Rot. Take the stairs to your left to find the last Site of Grace before the Romina, Saint of the Bud boss fight in Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree .

How To Beat Romina, Saint of the Bud In Elden Ring Shadow Of The Erdtree

Romina, Saint of the Bud is a necessary boss to beat to progress in the main story of the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC. Their main strength is their ability to apply Rot with all their attacks, especially when they catch you with one of their tails. They’re also very mobile and make the most of their arena by moving to a different location with each one of their attacks, which makes landing hits on them a hard task for melee players.

Unlike most of the DLC bosses, it’s not recommended to use shields against Romina since they apply Rot and aren’t very aggressive. Romina's pattern is consistent and normal, while their hits are hurtful if they land.

The boss is weak against Frost and Bleed , so go in there with your Mimic Tear and one of those two builds to deal more damage against them. The boss is also weak against heavy attacks and their stance will break every three to four heavies . For that, it’s better to be aggressive against Romina and read their pattern to dodge their attacks with ease.

During the second phase, most of Romina’s moveset will start spreading Rot butterflies, which will build up the Rot meter faster. You can keep going after the Saint of the Bud since Rot will slowly reduce your HP or use some of Elden Ring ’s items and Spells that can cure Rot.

item.title: Days Gone Studio Apologizes for Fans Getting 'False Hope'
item.description:
Highlights

  • Bend Studio apologizes for false Days Gone sequel rumors.
  • Fans were excited about a potential sequel, but it was rejected by Sony.
  • Bend Studio is now working on a new IP.

A community manager for Days Gone developer Bend Studio apologized to fans who were disappointed to learn the company was not working on a sequel to its 2019 action-adventure zombie game. Some players were unhappy when it was revealed Bend Studio's pitched sequel for Days Gone was rejected by Sony back in 2021 due to the first game's lengthy development time and lukewarm critical reception. However, many fans still held out hope that a sequel might be possible in the future, leading them to preemptively celebrate when false claims of a new entry into the franchise spread all over several social media sites.

The Days Gone fan base has recently been abuzz with excitement after a known leaker shared a rumor claiming Bend Studio was in the process of developing a continuation of its post-apocalyptic zombie game for the PlayStation 5. However, other insiders have continuously expressed skepticism about the claim. Many fans were also doubtful considering the developers previously announced they were already busy with the production of another separate project, which will reportedly be Bend Studio's take on a unique live-service IP.

Now, Bend Studio community manager Kevin McAllister has all but confirmed that rumors of an upcoming Days Gone sequel were outright wrong. In a post to Twitter, McAllister apologized to the members of the Days Gone player base who were deceived by "people looking after likes," with the community manager acknowledging they were unfairly targeted. He concluded his message by assuring fans that Bend Studio was hard at work on its upcoming title, promising to keep everyone updated on the ongoing development of current and future projects.

Bend Studio's Next Big Project

Though a Days Gone sequel isn't on Bend Studio's agenda for the foreseeable future, that's not to say fans of the studio have nothing to look forward to. Its upcoming video game might be its biggest undertaking to date, with reports claiming Sony invested $250 million in Bend Studio's newest project. While nothing has been outright confirmed, Sony has notably been trying to gain traction on the live-service market in recent years, and the overwhelming success of Arrowhead Game Studios' Helldivers 2 might have convinced it to invest in similar live-service titles.

However, it remains to be seen if its bet will pay off, as many of the details surrounding the project remain a mystery. Despite the lack of news regarding development, Bend Studio teased that production was proceeding smoothly, and McAllister also previously claimed the next game from the Days Gone developer will be its best game yet.
